summary: Email chain between Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and Palm Beach County officials regarding a request for grand jury materials from the state prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein. The SDNY prosecutors are investigating Epstein and prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell and seek transcripts and records from the Florida grand jury.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Primary correspondent from the Southern District of New York seeking grand jury materials related to Jeffrey Epstein for the ongoing federal investigation and prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Colleague of the primary AUSA, copied on the email request for grand jury materials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the original state grand jury proceedings in Palm Beach County and the ongoing federal investigation mentioned by the prosecutors.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the federal prosecution being handled by the SDNY prosecutors who are requesting the grand jury materials.

persons.name: Chief Communications Officer Executive Clerk & Comptroller
persons.context: Palm Beach County official who initially receives the request and redirects it to the appropriate legal and records personnel.

persons.name: Chief Operating Officer for Courts and Legal Records
persons.context: Palm Beach County official identified as the correct contact to handle the request for grand jury materials.

persons.name: Acting General Counsel
persons.context: Palm Beach County legal official copied on the email to assist with the request for grand jury materials.

connections.description: Federal prosecutors working together on the Epstein investigation and Maxwell prosecution, as indicated by being copied on the same request.
The AUSA is part of the team handling the ongoing federal investigation regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
The AUSA is one of the federal prosecutors handling the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
Implied by the context of the federal investigation and prosecution; Maxwell's prosecution is part of the ongoing investigation regarding Epstein.

connections.person1: Chief Communications Officer Executive Clerk & Comptroller
connections.person2: Chief Operating Officer for Courts and Legal Records
connections.description: Both are Palm Beach County officials; the Communications Officer connects the prosecutor to the COO for assistance.

events.title: State Grand Jury Proceedings for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Grand jury presentations were conducted in Palm Beach County, Florida, in connection with the prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein (Case No. 50-2006-CF-009454 AXX).

events.title: Initial Request for Grand Jury Materials
events.description: Assistant United States Attorney from SDNY emails Palm Beach County officials to request transcripts and records from the Epstein grand jury for the ongoing federal investigation.
personsInvolved: Chief Communications Officer Executive Clerk & Comptroller

events.title: Signed Unsealing Order Provided
events.description: An email indicates a signed unsealing order is attached for the transfer of grand jury documents.

events.title: Follow-up on Document Transfer
events.description: Email follow-up to discuss the transfer of documents, with an AUSA apologizing for delay due to being in court.

locations: Southern District of New York, New York, NY 10007
15th Judicial Circuit, Palm Beach County, Florida
301 N. Olive Ave., 9th Floor, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively seeking grand jury materials from Jeffrey Epstein's 2006 state prosecution in Palm Beach County as part of their ongoing investigation in October 2020.
The request was made to support both the investigation regarding Jeffrey Epstein and the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
The correspondence reveals procedural steps, including obtaining a federal unsealing order, to access state grand jury materials.
The email chain demonstrates coordination between federal prosecutors and Palm Beach County court and legal records officials.
The document references Case No. 50-2006-CF-009454 AXX, the original state case against Epstein in Florida.
